    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Cassisian (Archive Angel)</h1>The weakest of angels, cassisians usually serve as lackey messengers for more powerful angels or as spiritual guides for mortals. Despite their limited intellect, cassisians have a knack for precise recollection, particularly with scripture. Most cassisians are formed from the souls of trustworthy mortals, but some arise from fragments of greater angels destroyed in service to the celestial realms.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Celestial</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 15<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=13">Cassisian</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 1</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Angel_Cassisian.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Angel_Cassisian.png"></a><span alt="Neutral Good" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Good">NG</span><span alt="Tiny" class="traitsize" title="Tiny">Tiny</span><span alt="Angel Trait" class="trait" title="This family of celestials is native to the plane of Nirvana. Most angels are neutral good, have darkvision, and have a weakness to evil damage."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=8">Angel</a></span><span alt="Celestial Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the good-aligned planes are called celestials. Celestials can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=23">Celestial</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 16</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +6; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=16"><u>Celestial</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=2"><u>Draconic</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +6, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +6, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +6, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +6<br /><b>Str</b> -1, <b>Dex</b> +1, <b>Con</b> +2, <b>Int</b> -1, <b>Wis</b> +1, <b>Cha</b> +1<hr /><b>AC</b> 18 +1 status vs. evil creatures, <b>Fort</b> +7, <b>Ref</b> +6, <b>Will</b> +4; +1 status to all saves vs. evil creatures<br /><b>HP</b> 20; <b>Resistances</b> cold 3, fire 3; <b>Weaknesses</b> evil 3<br /><b>Transfer Protection</b> A non-evil creature can wear a willing cassisian as a helmet. While it does, the cassisian can take no actions, but the cassisian extends its +1 status bonus to AC and saves against evil creatures to its wearer. At any time, the cassisian can detach itself from its wearer as an action.<hr /><b>Speed</b> Fly 40 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> headbutt +6 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179"><u>finesse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=83"><u>good</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6-1 bludgeoning plus 1d4 good</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 16; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=247">read omens</a></u></i>; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=65">detect alignment</a></u></i> (at will, evil only), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=148">heal</a></u></i>; <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(1st)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=169">know direction</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=171">light</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Change Shape</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=127"><u>polymorph</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) A cassisian can take the appearance of a dove, a winged humanoid, a dog, or a fish. Normally, this doesn’t change its Speed or the attack and damage bonuses for its Strikes, but it might change the damage type Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). Any further changes for specific forms are noted below. <ul><li><b>Dog</b> size Small; scent (imprecise) 30 feet, Speed 40 feet; <b>Melee</b> jaws +7, Damage 1d6+2 piercing plus Knockdown</li><li><b>Fish</b> swim Speed 30 feet</li></ul></span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Eye Beams</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=65"><u>evocation</a></u>) The cassisian releases beams of heat or cold from its eyes, dealing 2d6 cold or fire damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save) to all creatures in a 15-foot line. It can’t use Eye Beams again for 1d4 rounds.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Repository of Lore</b> While the cassisian isn’t particularly intelligent, it has perfect memory and can remember everything it sees or hears. This allows it to attempt <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Skills.aspx?ID=8">Lore</a> checks on any topic, provided (at the GM’s discretion) the cassisian has encountered the topic in question before. The cassisian’s limited intellect often prevents it from acting upon its knowledge, making it a better resource than agent in matters of information use.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=3">Angel</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=16">Astral Deva (Emissary Angel)</a></td><td>14</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=15">Balisse (Confessor Angel)</a></td><td>8</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=13">Cassisian (Archive Angel)</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=14">Choral (Choir Angel)</a></td><td>6</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=3">Angel</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 16</i></a><br />The celestial hosts of angels are messengers and warriors, divided into choirs based on their abilities and purviews. The majority of angels are neutral good and live in Nirvana, the plane of virtue and enlightenment. However, some angels, including several angelic deities, have different alignments, and some even dwell on other planes. Regardless of alignment, angels remain benevolent messengers possessed with magical auras to aid their allies.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Angelic Divinities</h3>The most powerful angels belong to a category of demigods known as the empyreal lords—a title shared with other powerful good-aligned demigods among the host of archons, azatas, and other inhabitants of the celestial planes. The most powerful and most well-known of the angelic empyreal lords is Sarenrae.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Angelic Locations</h3>Angels normally live on Nirvana or other celestial planes, but their missions can bring them to the Material Plane. Spellcasters can conjure them for aid or advice in times of need, and they can even be found, if rarely, crusading against fiends in Hell, the Abyss, or anywhere in between.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Angelic Treasure</h3>Many angels wear exquisite armor or wield beautiful and often magical weapons. While they are not hampered by mortal sins like greed or pride (save for the very rare and tragic exception), they do enjoy the beauty of fine clothing, exquisite jewelry, and works of art.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Angels</h3>The most powerful angels are known as the solars, but numerous others can be found in Nirvana working their own missions or goals. Angels generally appear as beautiful, often somewhat androgynous humanoids, and the most powerful often possess two or even four sets of feathered wings.</span>

    <br />

          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
